title: SB 649
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. Section 35551 of the Vehicle Code is amended to set weight limits for groups of consecutive axles on highways based on distance. The total gross weight in pounds imposed by two or more axles must not exceed specified limits for different axle configurations and distances. The Vehicle Code is amended to set weight limits for groups of consecutive axles on highways based on distance. The total gross weight imposed by two or more axles must not exceed specified limits for different axle configurations and distances, ranging from 40,000 to 59,500 pounds. The Vehicle Code sets weight limits for groups of consecutive axles on highways based on distance, ranging from 40,000 to 70,000 pounds for different axle configurations. The Vehicle Code sets weight limits for groups of consecutive axles on highways, ranging from 40,000 to 80,000 pounds for different axle configurations. The Vehicle Code specifies weight limits for groups of consecutive axles on highways, ranging from 40,000 to 80,000 pounds for different axle configurations. Additionally, two consecutive sets of tandem axles may carry a gross weight of 34,000 pounds each if the overall distance between the first and last axles is 36 feet or more, with a maximum combined weight of 68,000 pounds. The distance between axles must be measured to the nearest whole foot, with fractions of exactly six inches rounded up to the next whole foot. This section does not impact the authority to restrict highway or bridge usage as outlined in other articles. Gross weight limits specified here and in Section 35550 include enforcement tolerances.
